meanings.definition: Resistant to damage or fading caused by the sun.
meanings.sent1: The sunproof umbrella kept us cool and shaded during the hot day.
meanings.sent2: It's important to wear sunproof clothing to protect your skin from harmful UV rays.
meanings.sent3: The sunproof hat saved the day by shielding us from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent4: Her sunproof sunglasses were like a shield against the bright sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sunproof paint on the house ensured it stayed vibrant and colorful under the sun.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to damage or fading caused by the sun.
meanings.sent1: She sunproofed her car windows to prevent the interior from fading.
meanings.sent2: Remember to sunproof your garden furniture to make it last longer.
meanings.sent3: He decided to sunproof his phone screen to avoid glare when using it outside.
meanings.sent4: The gardener sunproofed the plants by moving them to a shadier spot.
meanings.sent5: The painter sunproofed the mural so it wouldn't lose its colors in the sun.
